Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the Azure Functions project, including expected traffic, scalability needs, and integration with other Azure services.
Design the architecture for the Function App, including triggers, bindings, and integration points with other services like Azure Storage or Event Grid.

Tasks.Task: Set Up Azure Subscription and Resource Group
Tasks.Task Description: Ensure an Azure subscription is available and create a dedicated resource group for the Function App to organize resources.
Create the Function App in the Azure portal, CLI, or PowerShell, specifying the runtime stack, region, and hosting plan (e.g., Consumption or Premium).
Set up application settings, including connection strings, environment variables, and any required secrets using Azure Key Vault.
Enable security features such as Managed Identity, IP restrictions, and Azure Application Gateway for secure access to the Function App.
Write the function code using the chosen runtime and deploy it to the Function App using tools like Visual Studio, VS Code, or Azure DevOps.
Configure monitoring using Azure Monitor and Application Insights to track performance, errors, and usage metrics. Set up alerts for critical issues.
Perform functional and load testing to ensure the Function App meets performance and reliability requirements.
Set up a continuous integration and deployment pipeline using Azure DevOps or GitHub Actions for automated deployments.
Document the Function App architecture, configurations, and operational procedures for future reference and team onboarding.
Provide training and knowledge transfer sessions to the operations team for managing and troubleshooting the Function App.
Schedule regular maintenance tasks, such as updating dependencies, reviewing logs, and optimizing performance.
Conduct periodic security and compliance audits to ensure the Function App adheres to organizational and regulatory standards.
Use Azure Monitor and Application Insights to continuously monitor the health and performance of the Function App. Investigate any anomalies or errors.
Ensure the Function App is running on the latest supported runtime version to maintain security and compatibility.
Regularly review and rotate access keys for the Function App to ensure security and prevent unauthorized access.
Analyze performance metrics and logs to identify bottlenecks or inefficiencies in the Function App. Implement optimizations as needed.
Regularly back up the Function App configuration and code to ensure recovery in case of accidental changes or failures.
Simulate failover scenarios to ensure the Function App can recover gracefully in case of outages or disruptions.
Check and adjust scalability settings, such as plan type and instance count, to ensure the Function App can handle expected workloads.
Perform incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or Function App outages.
Analyze billing data to identify cost-saving opportunities and ensure the Function App is operating within budget.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Azure Functions features and best practices.
